definition: to do as one pleases/to not inconvenience oneself
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
see 便宜|便宜[pian2 yi5]
to allow sb to do sth at his convenience

sentences.english: We serve many kinds of drinks. Please help yourself.
sentences.chinese: 我们供应很多种饮料，请自便。

sentences.english: yeah, help yourself, stay or whatever.
sentences.chinese: 是的，她请我们自便，呆着或做其他的。

sentences.english: Remove Quickstart Guide and Nook Manual from Library (yes, no)?
sentences.chinese: 是否删除随机带的说明书，这个也自便。

sentences.english: A nun approaches: “Welcome, welcome, please feel free.”
sentences.chinese: 一位修女走过来对我说，“欢迎，欢迎，请自便。”

sentences.english: Professor let everyone own devices, free to drink coffee.
sentences.chinese: 教授让大家自便，随意喝点咖啡。

sentences.english: When she doesn’t feel like talking, we just let her be.
sentences.chinese: 她不想谈话时，我们就听其自便吧。

sentences.english: Help yourself, I hope you enjoy it.
sentences.chinese: 自便哦，希望您能吃得开心。

sentences.english: Please help yourself, don't hang back.
We serve ma sorts of drinks. Pleautomotive service engineers help yourself.
sentences.chinese: 我们提供很多种饮料，请自便。

sentences.english: Can you amuse yourselves while I write some letters?
sentences.chinese: 我写信的时候，各位能否自便？

sentences.english: Go on and keep fighting if you want.
sentences.chinese: 你们想继续打架的话，就自便好了。

sentences.english: I don't know your preference, so please help yourself.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道你喜欢什么，请你自便。

sentences.english: I can go at any time, so suit yourself regarding arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 我随时都可以走，怎么安排，请自便。

sentences.english: Yeah, shall we start? Please help yourself.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以开始吃了吗？请自便。

definition: Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
same as 慢慢吃[man4 man4 chi1]
(honorific) to accompany/to keep sb company
goodbye (modest formula)/Excuse me, I must leave.
to do one's best/to shape up/to behave/to fend for oneself/you're on your own
to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
you're welcome/don't mention it/no need to stand on ceremony
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
another day/some other day
to do as one sees fit/to play it by ear (according to the circumstances)
(said by departing guest) no need to see me out
I'm sure we'll meet again some day. (idiom)/Hope to see you again.
please find sb better qualified than me (idiom)
deference is no substitute for obedience (idiom)/(said to accept sb's request, invitation etc)
pinyin: gong1 jing4 bu4 ru2 cong2 ming4
